name: Mango Slaw
description: There is absolutely nothing new about coleslaw, but there is something slightly intriguing about coleslaw with mangos. Often, when we think of coleslaw, we think of it as a side for fish and chips, barbecue or heavy, mayonnaise-drenched cabbage. But just think about the cool, crunchy sweetness of the cabbage, carrots and mango, paired with the spicy kick of jerk chicken. What’s a better combination? You also don’t have to serve it as a side: It can be tucked into a sandwich or wrap. One of the best things about this recipe is that all the ingredients are readily available, and there are many shortcuts you can take, like using a bagged mix. Who wants to ruin their knuckles on a box grater, or break out the food processor?
recipeCategory: dinner, easy, lunch, quick, slaws, side dish
keywords: cilantro, cole slaw, mango, fourth of july, kwanzaa, labor day, memorial day, summer, vegetarian
recipeIngredient: 2 large, slightly firm mangoes (about 1 3/4 pounds), peeled, pitted and thinly sliced (about 2 cups)

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, combine all ingredients. Toss with tongs or a fork to combine.
Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Serve cold.
